DataElement.preferredName: Intervention or Procedure Administered Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The named location of or within the body for an activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A particular course of action intended to achieve a result.

Concepts.definition: An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The structures that surround and contact the parotid gland, forming the boundaries of the parotid space.

Concepts.definition: The structures that surround and contact the parotid gland, forming the boundaries of the parotid space.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy to the entire body. Usually followed by bone marrow or peripheral stem cell transplantation.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the irradiation of the whole body with ionizing or non-ionizing radiation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to the vagina or to any sheath.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to the vagina.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The bones that form the head, made up of the bones of the braincase and face.

Concepts.definition: The bones that form the head, made up of the bones of the braincase and face.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The region of the body between the neck and the upper arm.

Concepts.definition: The region of the body between the neck and the upper arm.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any one of the paired bones, 12 on either side, extending from the thoracic vertebrae toward the median line on the ventral aspect of the trunk. The long curved bones which form the rib cage. Generally, ribs 1 to 7 are connected to the sternum' by their costal cartilages and are called true ribs, whereas ribs 8 to 12 are termed false ribs.

Concepts.definition: Any one of the paired bones, 12 on either side, extending from the thoracic vertebrae toward the median line on the ventral aspect of the trunk. The long curved bones which form the rib cage. Generally, ribs 1 to 7 are connected to the sternum by their costal cartilages and are called true ribs, whereas ribs 8 to 12 are termed false ribs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any one of the air-filled spaces within the ethmoid, frontal, maxillary, or sphenoid bones, which communicate with the nasal cavity.

Concepts.definition: Any one of the air-filled spaces within the ethmoid, frontal, maxillary, or sphenoid bones, which communicate with the nasal cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The bony cavity of the skull which contains the eye, anterior portion of the optic nerve, ocular muscles and ocular adnexa.  Seven bones contribute to the structure of the orbit: the frontal, maxillary, zygomatic, sphenoid, lacrimal, ethmoid, and palatine bones.

Concepts.definition: The bony cavity of the skull which contains the eye, anterior portion of the optic nerve, ocular muscles and ocular adnexa. Seven bones contribute to the structure of the orbit: the frontal, maxillary, zygomatic, sphenoid, lacrimal, ethmoid, and palatine bones.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to the eye.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to the eye.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The region that connects the head to the rest of the body.: Involving only one part or side.

Concepts.definition: The region that connects the head to the rest of the body.
Involving only one part or side.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The region that connects the head to the rest of the body.: Affecting both sides of the body, or a matched pair of organs.

Concepts.definition: The region that connects the head to the rest of the body.
Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the pharynx in the back of the throat, at and above the soft palate. The nasopharynx is continuous with the nasal passages.

Concepts.definition: The part of the pharynx in the back of the throat, at and above the soft palate. The nasopharynx is continuous with the nasal passages.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The proximal portion of the respiratory passages on either side of the nasal septum lying between the floor of the cranium and the roof of the mouth and extending from the face to the pharynx. The nasal cavity is lined with ciliated mucosa, extending from the nares to the pharynx.

Concepts.definition: The proximal portion of the respiratory passages on either side of the nasal septum lying between the floor of the cranium and the roof of the mouth and extending from the face to the pharynx. The nasal cavity is lined with ciliated mucosa, extending from the nares to the pharynx.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A group of organs surrounded by loose connective tissue, separating the two pleural sacs, between the sternum anteriorly and the vertebral column posteriorly as well as from the thoracic inlet superiorly to the diaphragm inferiorly. The mediastinum contains the heart and pericardium, the bases of the great vessels, the trachea and bronchi, esophagus, thymus, lymph nodes, thoracic duct, phrenic and vagus nerves, and other structures and tissues.

Concepts.definition: An anatomic site along the midline and under the sternum that contains the heart and pericardium, the bases of the great vessels, the trachea and bronchi, esophagus, thymus, lymph nodes, thoracic duct, phrenic and vagus nerves, and other structures and tissues.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of extended radiation field that includes lymph node areas in the neck, chest, and axilla.

Concepts.definition: A type of extended radiation field that includes lymph node areas in the neck, chest, and axilla.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.

Concepts.definition: A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated Short Name to be the Public ID per current conventions for VM Short Name. DW 10-03-2022

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The cartilaginous structure of the respiratory tract between the pharynx and the trachea. It contains elastic vocal cords required for sound production.

Concepts.definition: The cartilaginous structure of the respiratory tract between the pharynx and the trachea. It contains elastic vocal cords required for sound production.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A radiation field that covers the anterior chest well in the shape of an inverted 'Y'. It includes the inguinal, femoral, pelvic, and para-aortic nodal area.

Concepts.definition: A radiation field that covers the anterior chest well in the shape of an inverted 'Y'. It includes the inguinal, femoral, pelvic, and para-aortic nodal area.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lateral prominence of the pelvis from the waist to the thigh.

Concepts.definition: The lateral prominence of the pelvis from the waist to the thigh.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The total system of structures outside the lungs that move as a part of breathing; it includes all structures from the skin to the parietal pleura.

Concepts.definition: The total system of structures outside the lungs that move as a part of breathing; it includes all structures from the skin to the parietal pleura.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Axilla; the hollow under the arm where it is joined to the shoulder.

Concepts.definition: The underside concavity where the arm and the shoulder are joined.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The superior portion of the abdomen.

Concepts.definition: The superior portion of the abdomen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Paired glands situated in the retroperitoneal tissues at the superior pole of each kidney.

Concepts.definition: A flattened, roughly triangular body resting upon the upper end of each kidney; it is one of the ductless glands furnishing internal secretions (epinephrine and norepinephrine from the medulla and steroid hormones from the cortex).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (SER-viks) The lower, narrow end of the uterus that forms a canal between the uterus and vagina.

Concepts.definition: The lower part of the uterus occupying the region between the isthmus of the uterus and the vagina. It is divided into supravaginal and vaginal portions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum. The right kidney is located below the liver and the left kidney below the diaphragm. The kidneys filter and secret the metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining the homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.

Concepts.definition: One of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum. The right kidney is located below the liver and the left kidney below the diaphragm. The kidneys filter and secrete metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.7 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Concepts.definition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The cavity lying at the upper end of the alimentary canal, bounded on the outside by the lips and inside by the oropharynx and containing in humans the tongue, gums, and teeth.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located at the upper end of the alimentary canal, behind the teeth and gums that is bounded on the outside by the lips, above by the hard and soft palates and below by the tongue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-encapsulated elongated and lobulated organ, extending from the concavity of the duodenum to the spleen; it consists of a head, an elongated body, and a tail. It contains two functional components: an exocrine component that secretes juices into the intestine and an endocrine component that secretes hormones (insulin and glucagon).

Concepts.definition: An organ behind the lower part of the stomach that is the shape of a fish and about the size of a hand. It is a compound gland composed of both exocrine and endocrine tissues. The endocrine pancreas makes insulin so that the body can use glucose (sugar) for energy. The exocrine pancreas makes enzymes that help the body digest food. Spread all over the pancreas are areas called the Islets of Langerhans. The cells in these areas each have a special purpose. The alpha cells make glucagon, which raises the level of glucose in the blood; the beta cells make insulin; the delta cells make somatostatin. There are also PP cells and D1 cells, about which little is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The structure of the vertebrate skeleton supporting the lower limbs in humans and the hind limbs or corresponding parts in other vertebrates.

Concepts.definition: The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A gland in males that surrounds the neck of the BLADDER and the URETHRA. It secretes a substance that liquifies coagulated semen. It is situated in the pelvic cavity behind the lower part of the PUBIC SYMPHYSIS, above the deep layer of the triangular ligament, and rests upon the RECTUM.

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal.

Concepts.definition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Refers to muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, blood vessels, or other supporting tissue of the body.

Concepts.definition: A general term comprising tissue that is not hardened or calcified; including muscle, fat, blood vessels, nerves, tendons, ligaments and fascia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A series of bones, muscles, tendons, and other tissues reaching from the base of the skull to the tailbone. The vertebral column forms the axis of the skeleton and encloses as well as protects the spinal cord and the fluid surrounding the spinal cord.

Concepts.definition: A series of bones, muscles, tendons, and other tissues reaching from the base of the skull to the tailbone. The vertebral column forms the axis of the skeleton and encloses as well as protects the spinal cord and the fluid surrounding the spinal cord.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (THIGH-royd) A gland located beneath the voice box (larynx) that produces thyroid hormone. The thyroid helps regulate growth and metabolism.

Concepts.definition: An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the pharynx between the soft palate and the upper portion of the epiglottis.

Concepts.definition: The part of the pharynx between the soft palate and the upper portion of the epiglottis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis.: A modifier term indicating a condition to follow.: A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.
A modifier term indicating a condition to follow.

A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues.  An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region. Representative examples include the heart, lung, liver, spleen, and uterus.
Not stated explicitly or in detail.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The female genital canal, extending from the uterus to the vulva.

Concepts.definition: The female genital canal, extending from the uterus to the vulva.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hollow, thick-walled, muscular organ located within the pelvic cavity of a woman. Within the uterus the fertilized egg implants and the fetus develops during pregnancy.: Add as part of something else; put in as part of a set, group, or category.: The mucous membrane comprising the inner layer of the uterine wall; it consists of a simple columnar epithelium and a lamina propria that contains simple tubular uterine glands. The structure, thickness, and state of the endometrium undergo marked change with the menstrual cycle.

Concepts.definition: A hollow, thick-walled, muscular organ located within the pelvic cavity of a woman. Within the uterus the fertilized egg implants and the fetus develops during pregnancy.
Add as part of something else; put in as part of a set, group, or category.

The mucous membrane comprising the inner layer of the uterine wall; it consists of a simple columnar epithelium and a lamina propria that contains simple tubular uterine glands. The structure, thickness, and state of the endometrium undergo marked change with the menstrual cycle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Transitional epithelium lining the renal pelvis, bladder, ureter, and part of the urethra.

Concepts.definition: Transitional epithelium lining the renal pelvis, bladder, ureter, and part of the urethra.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The thick-walled tube that carries urine from each kidney to the bladder.

Concepts.definition: The thick-walled tube that carries urine from each kidney to the bladder.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The two organs situated in the throat on either side of the narrow passage from the mouth to the pharynx. They are composed of lymphoid tissues.

Concepts.definition: The two organs situated in the throat on either side of the narrow passage from the mouth to the pharynx. They are composed of lymphoid tissues.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The muscular organ located in the floor of the mouth and serving as the principal organ of taste and modification of the voice in speech.

Concepts.definition: The muscular organ located in the floor of the mouth and serving as the principal organ of taste and modification of the voice in speech.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Either of the paired male reproductive glands that produce the male germ cells and the male hormones.

Concepts.definition: Either of the paired male reproductive glands that produce the male germ cells and the male hormones.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Beneath the skin.: Refers to muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, blood vessels, or other supporting tissue of the body.: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells, inflammatory cells, or cystic changes.

Concepts.definition: Beneath the skin.
A general term comprising tissue that is not hardened or calcified; including muscle, fat, blood vessels, nerves, tendons, ligaments and fascia.
A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells, inflammatory cells, or cystic changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ located under the diaphragm, between the liver and the spleen as well as between the esophagus and the small intestine. The stomach is the primary organ of food digestion.: Relating to the stomach.

Concepts.definition: The primary organ of food digestion. It is located under the diaphragm, between the liver and the spleen as well as between the esophagus and the small intestine.
Relating to the stomach.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that is part of the lymphatic system. The spleen produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys old blood cells. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach.

Concepts.definition: An organ that is part of the hematopoietic and immune systems. It is composed of the white pulp and the red pulp and is surrounded by a capsule. It is located in the left hypochondriac region. Its functions include lymphocyte production, blood cell storage, and blood cell destruction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The section of the intestines between the pylorus and cecum. The small intestine is approximately 20 feet long and consists of the duodenum, the jejunum, and the ileum. Its main function is to absorb nutrients from food as the food is transported to the large intestine.

Concepts.definition: The section of the intestines between the pylorus and cecum. The small intestine is approximately 20 feet long and consists of the duodenum, the jejunum, and the ileum. Its main function is to absorb nutrients from food as the food is transported to the large intestine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A recess, cavity, or channel.: Not characterized in any other way.

Concepts.definition: A recess, cavity, or channel.
Not characterized in any other way.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any one of the air-filled spaces within the ethmoid, frontal, maxillary, or sphenoid bones, which communicate with the nasal cavity.

Concepts.definition: Any one of the air-filled spaces within the ethmoid, frontal, maxillary, or sphenoid bones, which communicate with the nasal cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An exocrine gland that secretes saliva.  Salivary glands are mostly located in and around the oral cavity.

Concepts.definition: An exocrine gland that secretes saliva. Salivary glands are mostly located in and around the oral cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring in, or located in the retroperitoneum.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in, or located in the retroperitoneum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The area at the center of the kidney. Urine collects here and is funneled into the ureter, the tube that connects the kidney to the bladder.

Concepts.definition: The funnel-shaped proximal portion of the ureter located within the kidney into which urine is secreted, from the collecting duct system of the kidney.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Increased amounts of fluid within the pleural cavity. Symptoms include shortness of breath, cough, and chest pain. It is usually caused by lung infections, congestive heart failure, pleural and lung tumors, connective tissue disorders, and trauma.

Concepts.definition: Increased amounts of fluid within the pleural cavity. Symptoms include shortness of breath, cough, and chest pain. It is usually caused by lung infections, congestive heart failure, pleural and lung tumors, connective tissue disorders, and trauma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The tissue that lines the wall of the thoracic cavity and the surface of the lungs.

Concepts.definition: The tissue that lines the wall of the thoracic cavity and the surface of the lungs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The tissue that lines the wall of the abdominal cavity, intestine, and mesentery. It consists of the parietal peritoneum that covers the inside of the abdominal wall and the visceral peritoneum that covers the surface of the intestine and mesentery.

Concepts.definition: The tissue that lines the wall of the abdominal cavity, intestine, mesentery, and pelvic organs. It consists of the parietal peritoneum and the visceral peritoneum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A conical membranous sac filled with serous fluid in which the heart as well as the roots of the aorta and other large blood vessels are contained.

Concepts.definition: A conical membranous sac filled with serous fluid in which the heart as well as the roots of the aorta and other large blood vessels are contained.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Fluid collection within the pericardial sac, usually due to inflammation.

Concepts.definition: Fluid collection within the pericardial sac, usually due to inflammation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.: Of or belonging to a broader area or region of the body.

Concepts.definition: Any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.
Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.
Of or belonging to a broader area or region of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The male organ of urination and copulation.

Concepts.definition: The male organ of urination and copulation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.: Far apart in space from a point of origin on the body.

Concepts.definition: Any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.
Far apart in space from a point of origin on the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Not stated explicitly or in detail.: Named locations of or within the body.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Not stated explicitly or in detail.
Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Including all components without exception; constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.: The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.

Concepts.definition: Including all components without exception; constituting the full amount or extent or duration; complete.
The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

Concepts.definition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.

Concepts.definition: The anterior side of the thorax from the neck to the abdomen. The shape of the chest is often regarded as potential insight into a disease process, as in the case of barrel chest and respiratory dysfunction.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition with most recent NCIt version. mc 2/15/13

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.

Concepts.definition: The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the paired female reproductive glands containing the ova or germ cells; the ovary's stroma is a vascular connective tissue containing numbers of ovarian follicles enclosing the ova.

Concepts.definition: One of the paired female reproductive glands containing the ova or germ cells; the ovary's stroma is a vascular connective tissue containing numbers of ovarian follicles enclosing the ova.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A fold of peritoneum originating at the stomach and supporting the viscera.

Concepts.definition: A fold of peritoneum originating at the stomach and supporting the viscera.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A pear-shaped organ just below the liver that stores the bile secreted by the liver, delivering the bile through the bile ducts into the intestines to help with digestion.

Concepts.definition: A pear-shaped organ located under the liver that stores and concentrates bile secreted by the liver. From the gallbladder the bile is delivered through the bile ducts into the intestine thereby aiding the digestion of fat-containing foods.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The organ of sight or vision.

Concepts.definition: The organ of sight or vision.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated concept definition to use current NCIt. 4.5.18 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the digestive canal between the pharynx and stomach. It is about 25 cm long and consists of three parts: the cervical part, from the cricoid cartilage to the thoracic inlet; thoracic part, from thoracic inlet to the diaphragm; and abdominal part, below the diaphragm to the cardiac opening of the stomach.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the digestive canal between the pharynx and stomach. It is about 25 cm long and consists of three parts: the cervical part, from the cricoid cartilage to the thoracic inlet; thoracic part, from thoracic inlet to the diaphragm; and abdominal part, below the diaphragm to the cardiac opening of the stomach.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Fibromuscular tissue that separates the thoracic from the abdominal cavity. It increases the volume of the thoracic cavity through contractions, thus facilitating respiration.

Concepts.definition: Fibromuscular tissue that separates the thoracic from the abdominal cavity. It increases the volume of the thoracic cavity through contractions, thus facilitating respiration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the large intestine measured from the cecum to the rectum consisting of ascending, transverse, descending and sigmoid portions. The purpose of the colon is to remove water from digested food prior to excretion.

Concepts.definition: The part of the large intestine measured from the cecum to the rectum consisting of ascending, transverse, descending and sigmoid portions. The purpose of the colon is to remove water from digested food prior to excretion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/03/2015.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.

Concepts.definition: The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any of the ducts conveying bile between the liver and the intestine, including hepatic, cystic, and common bile duct.

Concepts.definition: Any of the ducts conveying bile between the liver and the intestine, including hepatic, cystic, and common bile duct.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lower opening of the digestive tract, lying in the cleft between the buttocks, through which fecal matter is extruded.

Concepts.definition: The lower opening of the digestive tract, lying in the cleft between the buttocks, through which fecal matter is extruded.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, which may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum.

Concepts.definition: The accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, which may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

Concepts.definition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or belonging to a broader area or region of the body.: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.: The underside concavity where the arm and the shoulder are joined.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to a broader area or region of the body.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.
The underside concavity where the arm and the shoulder are joined.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the same side of the body.: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the same side of the body.
One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the contractile organs of the body.

Concepts.definition: One of the contractile organs of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Abnormal enlargement of the spleen.

Concepts.definition: Abnormal enlargement of the spleen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Abnormal enlargement of the liver.

Concepts.definition: Abnormal enlargement of the liver.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Inflammation of the lymphatic vessels.

Concepts.definition: Inflammation of the lymphatic vessels.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The anterior portion of the head extending from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear. The facial structures contain the eyes, nose and mouth, cheeks and jaws.

Concepts.definition: The anterior portion of the head extending from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear. The facial structures contain the eyes, nose and mouth, cheeks and jaws.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The region of the body that includes the arm, the forearm, and hand._Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

Concepts.definition: The region of the body that includes the arm, the forearm, and hand.
Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The region of the body that includes the arm, the forearm, and hand._Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

Concepts.definition: The region of the body that includes the arm, the forearm, and hand.
Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The skin which covers the top of the head and which is usually covered by hair.

Concepts.definition: The skin which covers the top of the head and which is usually covered by hair.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Named locations of or within the body.

DataElement.administrativeNotes: added alt name OID, CCTG 5/31/22 CJL
